page.title: 13Origin of Chapel St.Leonards
page.content: The Parish of Chapel St.Leonards was part of the Parish of Mumby until the closing years of the 19th century. Mumby Church was the Parish Church until a Chapel of Ease was erected to serve the scattered community and dedicated to St.Leonard - a French Saint who gained popularity as patron of prisoners. On November 7th 1895 the parish of Chapel St.Leonards was constituted a separate civil parish and legally separated from the parish of Mumby cum Chapel by an order of the Lindsey County Council and the order came into force on the 1st April 1896.
